title: Israel Launches Airstrikes On Southern Lebanon | 10 News
description: Israel has launched an attack on Lebanon, with airstrikes hitting the southern town of Aanan on Monday, January 5. According to an Israeli military spokesperson, the strikes were targeting Hezbollah and Hamas military infrastructure in Hammara and Ain el-Tineh in eastern Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, and Kfar Hatta and Aanan in the south. The strikes came after evacuation orders were issued for four villages in the country’s east and south. The attacks are seen as a breach of the US‑brokered ceasefire agreed in late 2024, which halted more than a year of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah. Since then, both sides have accused each other of violating the ceasefire. title: Grok AI's Deepfake Images Spark Concern | 10 News+
description: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok is sparking outrage after it has been used to digitally remove the clothing of strangers and replace it with swimwear, in many cases without their consent or knowledge. title: Dawn Fraser Backs Bondi Royal Commission Calls | 10 News+
description: Australian Olympic legend Dawn Fraser has joined more than 60 other sporting greats to back calls for a royal commission into antisemitism following the Bondi Beach shooting.  She spoke to 10 News+ about her support for the Jewish community and why she is speaking up. title: Record-Breaking Bluefin Tuna Sells For $4.73 Million at Tokyo’s New Year Auction | 10 News
description: Now that’s a big fish!  A bluefin tuna has sold for a record ¥500 million (AUD $4.73 million) at the annual New Year auction at Tokyo’s Toyosu fish market.  The fish weighed 243 kilograms, with the prized catch purchased by Kiyomura Corp, a Tokyo-based operator of a popular sushi restaurant chain ‘Sushizanmai’.  The tuna was transported to Sushizanmai’s head restaurant, where it was ceremonially sliced before being distributed to the chain’s restaurants nationwide. title: Powerful 6.2 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Western Japan | 10 News
description: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.2 has struck western Japan on Tuesday, followed by a series of aftershocks.  Surveillance footage shows shaking at Tottori, Yonago and Miyoshi city across the Chugoku region when the quake hit just before 10:30am local time.  The Japan Meteorological Agency said the epicentre was in eastern Shimane Prefecture and there is no concern for a tsunami.  West Japan Railway said it had suspended Shinkansen bullet-train operations between Shin-Osaka and Hakata following the quake. title: Gunfire Heard Near Venezuelan Presidential Palace | 10 News
description: There have been reports of gunfire near Venezuela’s presidential palace in central Caracas on Monday, January 5. Government buildings in the area were reportedly evacuated as a precaution. A source close to the government told local media that unidentified drones were seen flying over the palace, prompting security forces to open fire in response, and that the situation was under control. title: Bondi Beach Shooting: Anthony Albanese Considers Backing Royal Commission | 10 News
description: After weeks of ruling out a Federal Royal Commission into the causes of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, tonight, all the signs of a backflip are coming from the Prime Minister. Anthony Albanese is "said to be" re-thinking his position, after lobbying from his own MPs, and a public revolt from former colleagues. title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro Declares He Is A Prisoner Of War | 10 News
description: The abducted Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has fronted a New York court for the first time since his shock capture by US forces, declaring himself a prisoner of war. Gunfire has been heard in Venezuela itself, as the Trump administration justified the military operation as "not war," just law enforcement. title: Heidelberg Sinkhole Triggers Immediate Stop To Tunnelling Work On Northeast Link | 10 News
description: The government has ordered an immediate stop to tunnelling work on the northeast link after a massive sinkhole opened up on the sporting ground at Heidelberg. Residents in the area say they were shocked to see the ground caving in on the popular reserve, and now they hold grave fears more could appear, putting homes at risk. title: Former US Marine Who Was Jailed In Venezuela Celebrates Maduro’s Capture | 10 News+
description: US Marine veteran Matthew Heath, who spent two years in a Venezuelan prison, says the capture of President Nicolas Maduro means Christmas has come early for him. He describes the strongman as a “bully” and claims the Venezuelan people “are more free today than they were yesterday”. The detained dictator Maduro has fronted a court in New York today, declaring that he is “innocent… a decent man, the president of my country”. title: Nicolas Maduro Fronts US Court | 10 News+
description: Nicolas Maduro, the detained dictator of Venezuela, has fronted a court in New York, declaring that he is “innocent… a decent man, the president of my country”.  It comes as US President Donald Trump is being accused of deceiving the American public about his true intentions with Venezuela, and the legality of his brazen operation to capture Maduro is being questioned. title: US Reduces Number Of Vaccines Recommended For Children | 10 News+
description: The United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has made a dramatic overhaul to its children’s vaccine schedule, reducing the amount of immunisations it recommends from 17 to 11. The advice no longer recommends protection against flu, rotavirus, hepatitis A, hepatitis B, and some forms of meningitis and RSV.
